results.title: The Road to books
results.creator_credit: Svensk Filmindustri, Unesco and Margaretha Rosencrantz
results.brief_description: An account of the community services provided by Swedish libraries. A typical library is shown - the building being attractively designed, spacious and well equipped. Aspects of library work include general reference and lending library, provision of material from central research libraries, picture collections, scores for music, gramophone records and documentary films. Special activities of the children’s department and adult education functions held at the library, are also shown.

results.title: The Road home [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Zhao Yu, Guangxi Film Studio and Zhang Yimou
results.brief_description: After the death of his father, Luo returns home to his village to help his mother with funeral arrangements. On his arrival he learns of his mother’s wish for a traditional burial for his father - something that has not been performed in the village for hundred of years. It is a costly and exhausting ceremony and Luo does not understand why they can’t have a simple funeral. Told in flashbacks, “The Road home” recounts Luo’s parents romance and how they captivated the village with their undying love for one other. Directed by Zhang Yimou (“Raise the Red Lantern”, “Not One Less”) and starring Zhang Ziyi (“Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon”), this is a beautiful tale of love and undeniable passion.

results.title: The Road back
results.creator_credit: Paul Doyle, Turner Home Entertainment and Time-Warner
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Muhammad Ali: the whole story”.
An in depth, six-part chronological document on one of the twentieth century’s greatest sportspersons, Muhammad Ali. This episode begins in 1970. Ali is the most loved and the most despised athlete in the world. He is in his prime, the fasted heavyweight boxer in the world. He is at a time when all other great and powerful boxers don’t even come close. He has never lost a fight. All but two of his long list of bouts were by knockout - until he fights Joe Frazier. Includes interviews with friends, foes and those that worked closely with him. Muhammad Ali himself, was a consultant for this series. Written by Gary Cohen. Narrated by Don Maseng.

results.title: The Road back
results.creator_credit: Vauxhall Motors and Luton and Dunstable Hospital
results.brief_description: The rehabilitation of injured employees at a large industrial organisation. The emphasis is on the severe injuries or illnesses which threaten chronic disablement and unemployment. How this can be greatly relieved or overcome by planned remedial work, with specially adapted machines and appliances under specialist medical supervision.

results.title: The Road = Lu
results.creator_credit: Fujian Film Company of the People's Republic of China and Lizhou Chen
results.brief_description:
The Chinese word “lu” (which directly translates to “road”) means finding a way. The narrative involves a group of working class men and women in their twenties, who are each trying to find their way in life. Everyday activities and living conditions make up a great part of the narrative; we see people lining up for goods, their daily struggles of working long hours for minimal wages and the lack of control they have over their predicament. Qui-Hu is given the chance to run the wool factory that she works for. She recruits her group of friends to assist her. It proves to be a difficult endeavour, due to government policies and the scale of their operation (they are unable to compete with bigger, state-run companies). They describe their factory to a “broken bowl”, whereas state-run plants are “iron bowls”, but these individuals now wish to aim for a “golden bowl”. A successful business will be golden because it would be created by them (independent group effort).

Historical Background:
The bleak nature of the film, with its portrayal of the struggles of the working class is representative of the “socialist realist” form of art that is popular within communist states. Socialist realism often glorifies the roles of the poor: it is the basis for art, with a clear goal to educate and propagate communist ideology. Recurring shots of the weathered Great Wall symbolises the youth of the nation and the struggles faced by the country; as the film concludes, the characters have come to terms with their situation-like the great wall, people’s lives can be rebuilt with teamwork and become great again.

Researcher’s Comments:
A slow-paced narrative with too many threads of events and mundane details; the results of which is a film that is neither interesting or engaging.
(2 stars - Mary Chen; May 22, 2010)

results.title: The Road
results.creator_credit: Vision Associates and Lee R. Bobker
results.brief_description: Presents several hours in a hospital of the Frontier Service in a remote area of Kentucky. The Frontier Service is a privately supported organisation which has an impressive record in public health and offers an example for others to follow.

results.title: The River: a first film
results.creator_credit: Arthur D. Nelles and Film Associates of California
results.brief_description: A river derives from the rain and snow that fall on the highest part of the land. The melting snow and the rain form streams, which eventually join to become a river which works its way downward toward the ocean. Along the way it flows through a lake and signs of man start to appear, with towns and cities. Some cities are used as river ports where ships transport goods and people.

results.title: The River without buoys = Yu Hang piao ti ho liao [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Mi Pai-chao, Xi'an Film Studio and Tian-Ming Wu
results.brief_description: Three loggers raft down a river in Hunan province. The picturesque scenery belies their harsh experiences: a painful reunion with a former lover for one; the loss by the youngest of his fiancee to another man; the struggle of a middle-aged father to make ends meet. Underlying the drama is the now recurrent theme in Chinese cinema of the hardships faced by the people during the Cultural Revolution, here expressed in very human terms. Cast includes Li Wei, T’ao Yu-ling and Sung Bao-sen. The film is also known as “Uncharted river” and “On a river without navigation marks”. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: The River wild
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Turman-Foster Company, David Foster, Lawrence Turman and Curtis Hanson
results.brief_description: Meryl Street is Gail, a former rafting instructor, returning to her old river with her husband and son for her son’s birthday, and to try and salvage what is left of her marriage. On the river they meet Wade (Kevin Bacon) and Terry, two fellow rafters on their way to Bridle Creek. Halfway down the river Gail discovers Wade and Terry abandoned by their guide and offers to lead them the rest of the way. This harmless act puts all their lives in danger as Wade and Terry reveal their true, evil selves. To save her family, Gail must face her own fears and run the Gauntlet - the most dangerous of all the rapids on the river.

results.title: The River that came clean
results.creator_credit: Christopher Riley and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
An environmental success story that begins by emphasising the role of sewage as a major pollutant of the River Thames since the mid 19th century. Shows evidence of the great increase in fish and bird life after a cleaning process was instigated. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
